newsitem.title: POLAND: ZYWIEC PLUNGES ON BREWERY CLOSURE.
newsitem.headline: ZYWIEC PLUNGES ON BREWERY CLOSURE.

text.p: Polish brewer Zywiec plunged 10 percent to 130.5 zlotys in a one-million-zloty turnover after the company said on Monday it was shutting down one of its breweries and sacking 145 of its 990 employees, traders said.
Some said, however, the company's unspectacular September earnings contributed to the fall.
"I think the market reacted nervously to the news, which doesn't really have to have such a negative impact on its future earnings," one trader said.
Zywiec said it would lay off the workers following decisions to shut down its Bielsko-Biala brewery.
It recorded a net profit of about 20,000 zlotys in September, down from 2.71 million in September last year.
